meanings.definition: The state or quality of being limp.
meanings.sent1: Her arms dangled with limpnesses after the long day.
meanings.sent2: The fabric's limpnesses made it difficult to sew.
meanings.sent3: The puppet's limpnesses caused it to flop around comically.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches swayed with limpnesses in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The chef's noodles had the perfect limpnesses for the dish.

meanings.sent1: He demonstrated the limpnesses of the ragdoll to the class.
meanings.sent2: The limpnesses of the patient concerned the doctor.
meanings.sent3: The limpnesses of the balloon made it float awkwardly.
meanings.sent4: The limpnesses of the rope made it impossible to climb.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's movements had a graceful limpnesses to them.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of lacking stiffness or firmness.
meanings.sent1: The cake's limpnesses indicated it was underbaked.
meanings.sent2: The limpnesses of the handshake showed nervousness.
meanings.sent3: The limpnesses of the flower petals made them look wilted.
meanings.sent4: The limpnesses of the paper made it tear easily.
meanings.sent5: The limpnesses of the old flag showed years of wear.
